alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 4:15PM CDT until June 04 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kansas... Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. For the Walnut River...including El Dorado, Augusta, Winfield, Arkansas City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut River at Winfield. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, A large portion of the fairgrounds flood along with rural roads about 3 miles northwest of Winfield that are near the river. Then one mile west of the city of Rock, expect 30th Road to be closed due to high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:01 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Walnut River Winfield 18.0 22.0 Thu 4 pm CDT 18.7 13.3 9.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
